subject: Fix cluster deletion when load balancers don't exist
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6484, 'name': 'Feilong Wang', 'email': 'hustemb@gmail.com', 'username': 'flwang'}, {'_account_id': 20498, 'name': 'Spyros Trigazis', 'email': 'strigazi@gmail.com', 'username': 'strigazi'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}, {'_account_id': 28022, 'name': 'Bharat Kunwar', 'email': 'brtknr@bath.edu', 'username': 'brtknr'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-01-22 15:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2021-01-22 15:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nPerhaps we should mention somewhere that to reproduce this, a user should try to create a cluster without the load-balancer_member role. Thanks for catching this corner case.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2021-01-22 16:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2021-01-23 23:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2021-02-01 21:12:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-22 15:26:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix cluster deletion when load balancers don't exist

During cluster deletion, magnum tries to delete the cluster's load
balancers in advance of deleting the heat stack. If these load balancers
do not exist for some reason, the cluster deletion will fail with an
error such as the following:

    Failed to pre-delete resources for cluster
    748b628a-2cd8-456f-8aee-c93804b2099b, error: list indices must be
    integers or slices, not str.

This happens because the heat stack has the physical_resource_id set to
None for the load balancer, which causes the load_balancer_show method
of octavia client to GET all load balancers, rather than just one. The
returned data is a list, rather than a dict, leading to the error above.

This change fixes the issue by checking if physical_resource_id is set
to None, and skipping the load balancer deletion if so.

Change-Id: I8f4ca497a01ad04db6cb6c4bc81caed0d714b5a6
Story: 2008548
Task: 41669
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cluster deletion when load balancers don't exist

During cluster deletion, magnum tries to delete the cluster's load
balancers in advance of deleting the heat stack. If these load balancers
do not exist for some reason, the cluster deletion will fail with an
error such as the following:

    Failed to pre-delete resources for cluster
    748b628a-2cd8-456f-8aee-c93804b2099b, error: list indices must be
    integers or slices, not str.

This happens because the heat stack has the physical_resource_id set to
None for the load balancer, which causes the load_balancer_show method
of octavia client to GET all load balancers, rather than just one. The
returned data is a list, rather than a dict, leading to the error above.

This change fixes the issue by checking if physical_resource_id is set
to None, and skipping the load balancer deletion if so.

Change-Id: I8f4ca497a01ad04db6cb6c4bc81caed0d714b5a6
Story: 2008548
Task: 41669

commit_message:
Drop lower constraints testing

Projects like oslo are dropping lower constraints
testing. There is also discussion to drop it until
we find a proper setup. For details, please follow
the ML thread. TC will have updates soon.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019679.html

commit_message:
Ansible-runner is failing when passing host to display

Ansible-runner is using their own custom call back and it appears to be
failing when actually set to a non-string. Check to make sure host is a
string or just unset it if it isn't a string value.

Change-Id: Ib67b6bd69ed1c3f9fcd32552b6599cbe4ff478ce
Closes-Bug: #1904917
(cherry picked from commit e737f3bfd4d3e98034d805e22e25a8bfb17d9c14)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-19 15:21:57.000000000', 'message': "Add ports to NFS server's firewalld

Change-Id: Ic6816fa647653baf8297dc62cdd99ee522b86535
"}, {'created': '2021-01-19 15:53:15.000000000', 'message': "Add ports to NFS server's firewalld

Closes-Bug: #1917891
Change-Id: Ic6816fa647653baf8297dc62cdd99ee522b86535
"}, {'created': '2021-01-19 16:30:22.000000000', 'message': "Opens ports to NFS server's firewalld

If the NFS server firewalld does not open the ports, ReaR cannot correctly mount the NFS server
while performing the backup and/or restore, and subsequently the action fails and the
openstack-ansible playbook stops running.

This change checks whether the server chosen to be NFS server has firewalld running, and implies that
if it is running, the operator must declare the firewalld zone where the ports must be opened.

Closes-Bug: #1912366
Change-Id: Ic6816fa647653baf8297dc62cdd99ee522b86535

commit_message:
Opens ports to NFS server's firewalld

If the NFS server firewalld does not open the ports, ReaR cannot correctly mount the NFS server
while performing the backup and/or restore, and subsequently the action fails and the
openstack-ansible playbook stops running.

This change checks whether the server chosen to be NFS server has firewalld running, and implies that
if it is running, the operator must declare the firewalld zone where the ports must be opened.

Closes-Bug: #1912366
Change-Id: Ic6816fa647653baf8297dc62cdd99ee522b86535

commit_message:
Add default value for enabled column in l7rule table

we don't set default value for enabled column now,
and mysql will fill them with 0 value(false)
if we upgrade from ocata or ealier, all l7rules is disabled.
so they will not render to haproxy config file in amphora.
this will cause all l7rules  stop work after a update.

Change-Id: Ib8549d71b7adb95d0dcb36903c1744190056adae

commit_message:
[Native CephFS] Add messages for async ACL ops

Access rules added to CephFS shares can fail
at the driver, or by the ceph volume client library.
Since the share manager can supply rule changes to
the driver in batches, the driver has to gracefully
handle individual rule failures.

Further some of the causes of the access rule
failures can be remedied by end users, therefore
asynchronous user messages would be a good vehicle
to register user faults that can be examined and
corrected.

Related-Bug: #1904015
[1] https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=2020-27781

Change-Id: I3882fe5b1ad4a6cc71c13ea70fd6aea10430c42e
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Raise 409 when removing security group from instance

currently when attempting to remove a security group from instance, nova
api returns 500 when there are more than one secuity groups with such
name in the project.

This patch makes it return 409 Conflict, using the same logic as already
present when adding a security group to the instance in such scenario of
duplicate names for security groups.

Change-Id: I28ad999c49d4e11add54405b89185b3f56f165b5
Closes-Bug: 1889655

[{'created': '2020-12-08 01:32:08.000000000', 'message': "Ensure ovsdb_probe_interval set before connect()

Setting the ovsdb_probe_interval after Connection.start() is
called means that the probe interval is not changed from
python-ovs's default of 5s until after the initial copy of the
database is retrieved. On busy systems, this can time out and
cause infinite reconnects.

This patch passes the probe_interval argument to the ovs.db.Idl
class so that it can be set as part of creating the jsonrpc
Session.

Some unit tests were removed and replaced with a functional test
which ensures not just that set_probe_interval is called, but that
the value is actually set before the connection is established.

Closes-bug: #1905611
(based on neutron commit 311071f567cc33d9868ba317536da18b7071d14e)

Change-Id: I54ede5de8cbfc5ac57a536dd1113be1213edc6e4

commit_message:
Ensure ovsdb_probe_interval set before connect()

Setting the ovsdb_probe_interval after Connection.start() is
called means that the probe interval is not changed from
python-ovs's default of 5s until after the initial copy of the
database is retrieved. On busy systems, this can time out and
cause infinite reconnects.

This patch passes the probe_interval argument to the ovs.db.Idl
class so that it can be set as part of creating the jsonrpc
Session.

Some unit tests were removed and replaced with a functional test
which ensures not just that set_probe_interval is called, but that
the value is actually set before the connection is established.

Closes-bug: #1905611
(based on neutron commit 5783e952887b2fe5e8aaa32b3077e8dcdefa7252)

Change-Id: I54ede5de8cbfc5ac57a536dd1113be1213edc6e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-24 04:38:58.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up how key manager backend is set for nova-compute

This change refactors current implementation to determine key manager
backend for nova-compute, based on the following two points.

- keymgr_api_class was deprecated a while ago. We can remove this
  parameter now.

- There are now requirement to redefine the parameter in puppet-tripleo

commit_message:
Refactor how key manager backend is set

This change refactors current implementation to determine key manager
backend for cinder and nova, based on the following two points.

- keymgr_api_class was deprecated a while ago. We can remove this
  parameter now.

- We don't have to redefine the parameter in puppet-tripleo layer but
  we can use the parameter implemented in puppet-nova or puppet-cinder
  directly.

Change-Id: I265ac3762823ea8930cc43150dc7b317f337f709

subject: Increase git clone depth from 10 to 20
messages: [{'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-02-01 13:37:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-02-01 16:52:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2021-02-01 17:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-01 13:37:48.000000000', 'message': 'Increase git clone depth from 10 to 20

The following error occured when cloning ceph-ansible.

cmdline: git reset --hard 54f7983be281f88714cbc75d393efa637e37ce17
stderr: 'fatal: Could not parse object '54f7983be281f88714cbc75d393efa637e37ce17'.'"]

There had been more than 10 commits to ceph-ansible since the previous OSA
sha bump so the role could not be cloned with depth=10. Double the clone depth
to make this less likley to happen

In addition this patch makes all centos-8 jobs non voting as this change plus
If765e3ca47aa0b05214306fba36f5c659d3d7373 is required to make centos-8
jobs pass tests again.

Change-Id: I0b7a077cc8ab43cedd198e094e473aaf4eafebdd
'}]
commit_message:
Increase git clone depth from 10 to 20

The following error occured when cloning ceph-ansible.

cmdline: git reset --hard 54f7983be281f88714cbc75d393efa637e37ce17
stderr: 'fatal: Could not parse object '54f7983be281f88714cbc75d393efa637e37ce17'.'"]

There had been more than 10 commits to ceph-ansible since the previous OSA
sha bump so the role could not be cloned with depth=10. Double the clone depth
to make this less likley to happen

In addition this patch makes all centos-8 jobs non voting as this change plus
If765e3ca47aa0b05214306fba36f5c659d3d7373 is required to make centos-8
jobs pass tests again.

Change-Id: I0b7a077cc8ab43cedd198e094e473aaf4eafebdd

commit_message:
Deprecate environments/dcn-hci.yaml for dcn-storage.yaml

Rename the file in the environments directory so that it
reflects its expanded scope. This file is used when
deploying storage with DCN sites regardless of if those
sites use HCI. We are now supporting non-HCI DCN sites
with storage so the old name is confusing.

Old name : dcn-hci.yaml
New name : dcn-storage.yaml

dcn-hci.yaml is depreacated but will remain in the environments
directory for backwards compatibility. dcn-hci.yaml will be
removed during the X cycle.

Change-Id: Ice5e1cfbc158eb6705988706c8625bedb80d7de2
(cherry picked from commit d4ae25e2fd53d1af59fa57947843474cf5c2887a)

commit_message:
Split network validation to it's own play

When we moved the network deployment to free, we can hit a race
condition where some nodes are being configured prior to the controllers
being ready. This can lead to the basic network validation failing.  We
can deal with this by moving the validation to it's own play so that we
ensure all network configurations have occurred prior to to checking
that nodes can ping the controllers.

Change-Id: I48665379a87e701633be1bcc90bd8be1cc75c513
Closes-Bug: #1913725

[{'created': '2020-09-02 12:04:39.000000000', 'message': "vmware tests: Support different moref backend representations

"}]
commit_message:
vmware tests: Support different moref backend representations

We want to switch the SOAP library backing oslo.vmware [1], which
changes how a ManagedObjectReference's attributes look like. To handle
the two representations in the tests - especially for the transition
period - we will set both attributes on fake.ManagedObjectReference.
Therefore, we have to use fake.ManagedObjectReference everywhere instead
of using manual Mock objects lacking one of the attributes.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/victoria/oslo-vmware-soap-library-switch.html

Change-Id: I9bccd7e5a75ecf83a1fea3cfe88078c68f043429

commit_message:
Restart glance after updating policy in job

When we write out the glance policy for the multistore job, we do
so after glance has already started. After the json->yaml change,
we will decide too early in g-api lifetime that the legacy file
isn't present and thus never honor it later. So, create it and then
restart glance services.

Change-Id: Ic1c01366dbfdcfb85750b85f960b76aea934db59

commit_message:
Add TLS context creation for Memcached backends

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context.
The context built from those options is passed to any of the django
backends supporting TLS connections (eg. pymemcache).

Change-Id: I3a31c8f27911022c51baceccd9613e6d5e732f60

Fix the log path on the host.

The path for the host machine is
/var/log/containers/mistral/package_update.log.

commit_message:
Configure OVNCMSOptions=enable-chassis-as-gw within neutron-ovn-sriov.yaml

In order to configure OVN+SRIOV, the following THT files need to be
imported:
  - neutron-ovn-ha.yaml
  - neutron-ovn-sriov.yaml

Change-Id: Ia918d8b92d9bb1efac9bec2017b88593bf362834
Resolves: rhbz#1913700
(cherry picked from commit 831f5d65fa4a30b37bb92c36a7c97005dbbd77f6)

commit_message:
Use consistent names for service_credentials options

This change renames aodh::auth and its parameters to be consistent
with the section name and the parameter names in aodh service. This
allows operators more easily guess how the class and its parameters
correspond to the options in aodh.

Change-Id: I7ddc4af25f89317da6a794beba312841d2f1bc25

commit_message:
Fix CI issues

This fixes several CI problems:

* Update the DevStack plugin to query for docker's cgroup driver
  correctly, because the old way suddenly stopped working.
* Cap bandit to 1.6.2 to keep it on version supporting py27.

Change-Id: I98ecd4dc041b271303ccbb4da61e33fa1a95800b

proceed.

then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

Change-Id: Id92ebdb45081dc8b0ac03c057533b9731097a6d9
'}]
commit_message:
Release zaqar-ui for stable/train

This release picks up new commits to zaqar-ui since
the last release from stable/train.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a  stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: Id92ebdb45081dc8b0ac03c057533b9731097a6d9

subject: [manila] Release manila 9.1.5
messages:
[{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-01-25 18:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2021-01-27 22:14:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-01-28 10:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

"[NetApp] Support NFS shares on windows" sounds a bit feature-y... is this worth a 9.2.0 instead?'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-28 15:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> "[NetApp] Support NFS shares on windows" sounds a bit feature-y... is this worth a 9.2.0 instead?

Not convinced... Looks like more to a bugfix, let's wait for team's opinion.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-01-28 19:57:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> "[NetApp] Support NFS shares on windows" sounds a bit feature-y... is this worth a 9.2.0 instead?

Hi Thierry, 

This is a bugfix - the vendor driver supports multiple versions of their storage hardware with manila;  The options added in the interface code were previously assumed; however the vendor switched defaults over versions. So, the manila driver had to be updated to explicitly provide these options with values. Without this override, NFS shares from newer versions of storage wouldn't work on Windows machines.

I agree the commit message sounds like it's net new functionality, it is not. No new feature's being added, just a storage regression worked around :)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-01-29 10:05:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks for the explanation!'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-02-01 17:06:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

The validation error is a bit weird, I didn't see significant changes since the version 0.2.0 and at this time this one was valid even with `cinder_tempest_plugin` [1].

This makes me think that we surely changed something in our validation around this date/patch, and I can see that ~3 months later we introduced a new YAML compliance to 1.2 [3].

I'm not sure how can fix that for now. I don't know if removing `tarball-base` could be an option, or if we can play with some repository settings [4] in this case, any idea?

[1] deliverables/stein/cinder-tempest-plugin.yaml: validate_tarball_base: tarball-base for openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin stein-last is set to 'cinder_tempest_plugin' but the sdist name is actually 'cinder-tempest-plugin'. It is too expensive to determine this value during the site build, please set it explicitly
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/1704aa624ae3220a5ed550d379ac6a5633d9650a
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/1704aa624ae3220a5ed550d379ac6a5633d9650a
[4] https://releases.openstack.org/reference/using.html"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-13 09:28:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> The validation error is a bit weird, I didn't see significant changes since the version 0.2.0 and at this time this one was valid even with `cinder_tempest_plugin` [1].
> 
> This makes me think that we surely changed something in our validation around this date/patch, and I can see that ~3 months later we introduced a new YAML compliance to 1.2 [3].
> 
> I'm not sure how can fix that for now. I don't know if removing `tarball-base` could be an option, or if we can play with some repository settings [4] in this case, any idea?
> 
> [1] deliverables/stein/cinder-tempest-plugin.yaml: validate_tarball_base: tarball-base for openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin stein-last is set to 'cinder_tempest_plugin' but the sdist name is actually 'cinder-tempest-plugin'. It is too expensive to determine this value during the site build, please set it explicitly
> [2] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/1704aa624ae3220a5ed550d379ac6a5633d9650a
> [3] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/1704aa624ae3220a5ed550d379ac6a5633d9650a

May passing `tarball-base: cinder_tempest_plugin` directly inline could help?
As did with https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/768546"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-01-13 09:49:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-13 10:11:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-01-14 03:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

The hash for wallaby (release 1.3.0) looks fine.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-01-14 14:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

[{'created': '2020-12-26 18:42:16.000000000', 'message': '[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein EM

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/stein/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

commit_message:
[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein-last

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

Tagging 'stein-last' as well as a new version also with same hash.
Documenting this new tag name here
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-team-guide/+/769821

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/stein/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

Change-Id: I51476fc19128c5604dd5934fc19a97cec0e5c0ce

commit_message:
Remove grenade jobs from old stable branches

As discussed and approved during the ironic wallaby midcycle, the grenade
jobs in old stable branches, starting from EM branches and up the oldest
not-EM (at this moment train) are removed.

Also remove lower-constraints job.

subject: Deprecate the mandatory flag
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8770, 'name': 'Ken Giusti', 'email': 'kgiusti@gmail.com', 'username': 'kgiusti'}, {'_account_id': 9257, 'name': 'John Eckersberg', 'email': 'jeckersb@redhat.com', 'username': 'jeckersb'}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27954, 'name': 'Mois√©s Guimar√£es de Medeiros', 'email': 'guimaraes@pm.me', 'username': 'moguimar'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-11-30 15:41:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2020-11-30 21:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Backport-Candidate+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2020-12-02 16:20:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I commented on the lp bug here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1905965/comments/1

But in summary, I don't think this would fix the problem and would actually make things worse."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-11 09:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-11 09:50:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I wonder if we can drop the mandatory flag option and only keep the `at_least_once` option.

The mandatory flag is useful and could be used everytime and I don't see reason to deactivate, I think it's preferable to only allow user to decide to loop over or simply re-raise it.

Now that we can define a more granular failing strategy by using at_least_once, I think we can abandon the `direct_mandatory_flag` and assume to use the mandatory flag everytime.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-11 14:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-11 14:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-11 14:33:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I tried to simulate the scenario with oslo.messaging's simulator, unfortunatelly I couldn't reproduce the MessageUndeliverable exception.

Find bellow the followed process, maybe you will have an idea oon how to simulate that.

1. Run a rabbitmq server and allow to access to the dashboard to monitor things:

```
$ sudo podman run -d -e RABBITMQ_NODENAME=rabbitmq \
    -p 5672:5672 \
    -p 15672:15672 \
    --name rabbitmq rabbitmq:3-management
```

2. Prepare some configuration to use with our simulator:

```
# tuto.conf
[DEFAULT]
transport_url = rabbit://localhost/
at_least_once = False
```

3. Run the RPC server

```
$ tox -e venv --  python tools/simulator.py --config-file ./tuto.conf -d rpc-server -w 40
```

Notice that I asked to the server to wait before answer to allow me to manually delete the reply queue on the rabbitmq server side.

4. Run the RPC client

```
$ tox -e venv --  python tools/simulator.py --config-file ./tuto.conf -d rpc-client
```

5. Delete the corresponding reply queue

```
$ sudo podman exec -it rabbitmq rabbitmqctl delete_queue reply_<id>
```

Unfortunatelly I can't fall into the expected situation by following this process... 

I suppose that some other mechanismes catch that something went wrong with this scenario and I didn't reach my expected scenario."}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2021-01-11 18:44:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Stepping back a bit, I'm wondering if we're doing the right thing using the 'mandatory' flag at all...

AFAIKT the original bug report that sent us down the path of using the mandatory flag is [0].  Re-reading that bug report leads me to believe the original desire was to have a way for the RPC _client_ to fail fast when the RPC server is not present.

This makes me question why we're using 'mandatory' on the RPC server side at all.  In fact, I'd argue the right solution to that original bug - RPC clients issuing calls before the RPC server is present - would be better solved outside of oslo.messaging by implementing a bespoke "ping" call with a short timeout.

TL;DR - should be reconsider using the mandatory flag at all?


[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1661510'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-13 13:36:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> Stepping back a bit, I'm wondering if we're doing the right thing using the 'mandatory' flag at all...
> 
> AFAIKT the original bug report that sent us down the path of using the mandatory flag is [0].  Re-reading that bug report leads me to believe the original desire was to have a way for the RPC _client_ to fail fast when the RPC server is not present.
> 
> This makes me question why we're using 'mandatory' on the RPC server side at all.  In fact, I'd argue the right solution to that original bug - RPC clients issuing calls before the RPC server is present - would be better solved outside of oslo.messaging by implementing a bespoke "ping" call with a short timeout.
> 
> TL;DR - should be reconsider using the mandatory flag at all?
> 
> 
> [0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1661510

I agree with you.

We could follow these steps:
- first, simply deactivate the mandatory flag by default and communicate loud about this to avoid back and forth with users that could started to support that flag on their side.
- Second, remove the mandatory flag usage from the RPC server side
- Third, focusing us on the RPC client side to try to keep the mandatory flag around to continue to fail early.

oslo.config's set_defaults could be used here to force the deactivation https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/src/commit/a626ad12fe5a3abd49d70e3e5b95589d279ab578/oslo_policy/opts.py#L121

These steps could let's us a chance for the future to improve O.M with the mandatory feature, and they could allow us to fix our present issue.

Let's wait a bit for John's feedback.'}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2021-01-14 22:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > Patch Set 3:
> > 
> > Stepping back a bit, I'm wondering if we're doing the right thing using the 'mandatory' flag at all...
> > 
> > AFAIKT the original bug report that sent us down the path of using the mandatory flag is [0].  Re-reading that bug report leads me to believe the original desire was to have a way for the RPC _client_ to fail fast when the RPC server is not present.
> > 
> > This makes me question why we're using 'mandatory' on the RPC server side at all.  In fact, I'd argue the right solution to that original bug - RPC clients issuing calls before the RPC server is present - would be better solved outside of oslo.messaging by implementing a bespoke "ping" call with a short timeout.
> > 
> > TL;DR - should be reconsider using the mandatory flag at all?
> > 
> > 
> > [0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1661510
> 
> I agree with you.
> 
> We could follow these steps:
> - first, simply deactivate the mandatory flag by default and communicate loud about this to avoid back and forth with users that could started to support that flag on their side.
> - Second, remove the mandatory flag usage from the RPC server side
> - Third, focusing us on the RPC client side to try to keep the mandatory flag around to continue to fail early.
> 
> oslo.config's set_defaults could be used here to force the deactivation https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/src/commit/a626ad12fe5a3abd49d70e3e5b95589d279ab578/oslo_policy/opts.py#L121
> 
> These steps could let's us a chance for the future to improve O.M with the mandatory feature, and they could allow us to fix our present issue.
> 
> Let's wait a bit for John's feedback.

Yeah this sounds good to me.  Definitely remove the mandatory flag usage on server side for now so we can unbreak that.  I think longer-term there is potential to benefit from the mandatory flag as it lets us fail fast in situations where we otherwise would wait for an rpc timeout.  Plus I think we could completely get rid of the exchange-probing that happens with the AMQPDestinationNotFound stuff and replace it with mandatory; that's a much more straightforward usage to achieve the same end.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-18 15:12:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-19 08:41:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

FYI I kept the previous PS active on a follow up patch to allow us to refine our use of the mandatory flag in a client mode.

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.messaging/+/771232/'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-19 08:42:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-22 11:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-22 13:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2021-01-25 16:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-30 15:41:51.000000000', 'message': 'Don't pass the mandatory flag with the direct RPC

The direct reply-to feature allows RPC clients to receive replies
directly from their RPC server, without going through a reply queue.
"Directly" here still means going through the same connection and a
RabbitMQ node; there is no direct network connection between RPC client
and RPC server processes.

The RPC server will then see a reply-to property with a generated name.
It should publish to the default exchange ("") with the routing key set
to this value (i.e. just as if it were sending to a reply queue as
usual). The message will then be sent straight to the client consumer.

However this feature have some caveats and limitations [5]...

Especially the fact that the name `amq.rabbitmq.reply-to` is used in
`basic.consume` and the `reply-to` property as if it were a queue;
however it is not. It cannot be deleted, and does not appear in the
management plugin or `rabbitmqctl list_queues`.

If the RPC server publishes with the mandatory flag set then
`amq.rabbitmq.reply-to.*` is treated as not a queue [5]; i.e. if the
server only publishes to this name then the message will be considered
"not routed" [5][6]; a `basic.return` will be sent if the mandatory flag
was set.

Example with nova. nova-compute's RPC server by replying by sending a direct
`reply-to` to the client saw these message non routed.
After awhile the client reached the timeout as the
message was never delivered to him, and then this had for side effect to
left a block_device_mapping record in the database, leaving it listed in
the os-volume_attachments API and `nova volume-attachments` output. This
also causes the subsequent attempts to attach the volume to fail as we
already have an active bdm record for it.

However even without this patch this bug could be easily solved by
disabling the `direct_mandatory_flag` option, it could be a simple
workaround to unlock those who face a similar issue.

If the customers/operators seeing this repeatedly in their environment
then they could try to disable the
`[oslo_messaging_rabbit]/direct_mandatory_flag` option in the computes
`nova.conf`.

Change-Id: I1cbafff03349f7da9224de46285707fbf2a81a68
Closes-Bug: #1905965
'}, {'created': '2021-01-11 09:43:47.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Allow to loop for timeout when a MessageUndeliverable is raised

MessageUnderliverable exception have been introduced by recently added
mandatory flag feature, however clients aren't prepared to handle
recover on their side and so it doesn't lets a chance to the requester to
restablishes itself.

These changes leave the mandatory flag feature as it was implemented
however they add the possibility to also define `at_least_once` in
configuration to allow to loop for a timeout while a message remains
underliverable, as did with AMQPDestinationNotFound exception.

If the client explicitly set at_least_once=True, then when
MessageUndeliverable is raised, we re-raise it back to the
client, with the assumption that it knows how to handle it.

If the client did not explicitly ask for it (the current case where nova
and such do not use this API), then we can still use the
functionality (the mandatory flag) within oslo.messaging, but we catch
it and not re-raise it, the same way AMQPDestinationNotFound works currently.

Change-Id: I1cbafff03349f7da9224de46285707fbf2a81a68
Closes-Bug: #1905965
"}, {'created': '2021-01-11 14:16:54.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Allow to loop for timeout when a MessageUndeliverable is caught

MessageUnderliverable exception have been introduced by recently added
mandatory flag feature, however clients aren't prepared to handle
recover on their side and so it doesn't lets a chance to the requester to
restablishes itself.

These changes leave the mandatory flag feature as it was implemented
however they add the possibility to also define `at_least_once` in
configuration to allow to loop for a timeout while a message remains
underliverable, as did with AMQPDestinationNotFound exception.

If the client explicitly set at_least_once=True, then when
MessageUndeliverable is raised, we re-raise it back to the
client, with the assumption that it knows how to handle it.

If the client did not explicitly ask for it (the current case where nova
and such do not use this API), then we can still use the
functionality (the mandatory flag) within oslo.messaging, but we catch
it and not re-raise it, the same way AMQPDestinationNotFound works currently.

Change-Id: I1cbafff03349f7da9224de46285707fbf2a81a68
Closes-Bug: #1905965
"}, {'created': '2021-01-18 15:12:15.000000000', 'message': "Disabling the mandatory flag by default

This feature was mostly introduced to have a way for the RPC _client_ to
fail fast when the RPC server is not present.

We shouldn't use the mandatory flag with the RPC server.

Also we didn't make enough noise related to this feature and to the
fact that we want to fail early and so services aren't ready to
handle this case and on oslo.messaging we didn't bring a way to
lets the time to redeclar exchanges properly. That lead us to a lot
of inconsistent state and unexpected behaviors.

The goal is to disabling this feature for a while to let's us time to
catch/handle this case more properly with follow up patches.

Change-Id: I1cbafff03349f7da9224de46285707fbf2a81a68
Closes-Bug: #1905965
"}, {'created': '2021-01-22 11:07:28.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate the mandatory flag

It will not be possible to deactivate this fonctionality anymore.

Change-Id: I1cbafff03349f7da9224de46285707fbf2a81a68
Closes-Bug: #1905965
'}, {'created': '2021-01-22 13:40:31.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate the mandatory flag

It will not be possible to deactivate this fonctionality anymore.

Change-Id: I1cbafff03349f7da9224de46285707fbf2a81a68
'}, {'created': '2021-01-25 20:04:38.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate the mandatory flag

It will not be possible to deactivate this fonctionality anymore.

Change-Id: I1cbafff03349f7da9224de46285707fbf2a81a68
'}, {'created': '2021-02-01 09:31:45.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate the mandatory flag

It will not be possible to deactivate this functionality anymore.

Change-Id: I1cbafff03349f7da9224de46285707fbf2a81a68
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate the mandatory flag

It will not be possible to deactivate this functionality anymore.

Change-Id: I1cbafff03349f7da9224de46285707fbf2a81a68

Release kolla-ansible for stable/train

This release picks up new commits to kolla-ansible since
the last release from stable/train.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a  stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

subject: libvirt: Correctly resize encrypted LUKSv1 volumes
messages:
[{'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-03-22 12:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-03-22 13:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build SUCCESSFUL (check pipeline).

- pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered http://52.27.155.124/95/714295/1/check/pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered/e5d6ae4/ : SUCCESS in 23m 29s'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-03-22 13:16:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-02-01 16:15:24.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-02-01 16:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-22 12:43:27.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Correctly resize encrypted LUKSv1 volumes

When extending volumes the Libvirt virt driver first calls os-brick to
refresh any host block devices so they show their new extended size
before calling down into Libvirt's virDomainBlockResize API to do the
same within the instance.

When extending encrypted LUKSv1 volumes the new size of the volume
provided to the virDomainBlockResize API did not previously take the
space already consumed by the LUKSv1 header into account. As a result
any attempt to extend a host block device based encrypted LUKSv1 volume
would fail as Libvirt would need to grow the device to allow room for
the LUKSv1 header.

This change corrects this by inspecting the host block device or remote
RBD volume using ``qemu-img info``. Since oslo.utils 4.1.0 the returned
QemuImgInfo object that encapsulates the output of this call now
includes LUKSv1 specific data such as the offset of the encrypted
payload, essentially where the users data actually starts within the
volume.

By subtracting this offset from the new overall size of the extended
volume we can ensure calls to virDomainBlockResize will now succeed as
no attempt will be made by Libvirt to grow the device.

Future work will also need to handle this extend_volume use case for
``dm-crypt`` based encryption providers ``plain`` and ``luks2``.

Closes-Bug: #1861071
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706880
Change-Id: I0c3f14100a18107f7e416293f3d4fcc641ce5e55
(cherry picked from commit 961df123934046b67fb95d1d18501913d5c20f29)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Correctly resize encrypted LUKSv1 volumes

When extending volumes the Libvirt virt driver first calls os-brick to
refresh any host block devices so they show their new extended size
before calling down into Libvirt's virDomainBlockResize API to do the
same within the instance.

When extending encrypted LUKSv1 volumes the new size of the volume
provided to the virDomainBlockResize API did not previously take the
space already consumed by the LUKSv1 header into account. As a result
any attempt to extend a host block device based encrypted LUKSv1 volume
would fail as Libvirt would need to grow the device to allow room for
the LUKSv1 header.

This change corrects this by inspecting the host block device or remote
RBD volume using ``qemu-img info``. Since oslo.utils 4.1.0 the returned
QemuImgInfo object that encapsulates the output of this call now
includes LUKSv1 specific data such as the offset of the encrypted
payload, essentially where the users data actually starts within the
volume.

By subtracting this offset from the new overall size of the extended
volume we can ensure calls to virDomainBlockResize will now succeed as
no attempt will be made by Libvirt to grow the device.

Future work will also need to handle this extend_volume use case for
``dm-crypt`` based encryption providers ``plain`` and ``luks2``.

Closes-Bug: #1861071
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706880
Change-Id: I0c3f14100a18107f7e416293f3d4fcc641ce5e55
(cherry picked from commit 961df123934046b67fb95d1d18501913d5c20f29)

commit_message:
images: Move qemu-img info calls into privsep

This is mostly code motion from the nova.virt.images module into privsep
to allow for both privileged and unprivileged calls to be made.

A privileged_qemu_img_info function is introduced allowing QEMU to
access devices requiring root privileges, such as host block devices.

Change-Id: I5ac03f923d9d181d22d44d8ec8fbc31eb0c3999e
(cherry picked from commit 03d6eb500f85a417f84a7bf4a9f4ceb275c9a67e)

commit_message:
images: Allow the output format of qemu-img info to be controlled

This will allow for the use of the JSON output format that is easier to
parse within QemuImgInfo and should allow additional information to be
extracted from qemu-img calls in the future.

Change-Id: I0b6d1a98726ffa1ebc78fb3c4563a2e4b40ddeff
(cherry picked from commit 28f3e0070a214f750ecad8bd8001ccb5c5c27fd4)

commit_message:
virt: Pass request context to extend_volume

Required by an upcoming bugfix to the Libvirt driver's implementation of
extend_volume that will require external authenticated calls to Cinder
and Barbican.

Change-Id: I0ef84dd0a6c3f1788caf7d3a8e3837203f6d5429
(cherry picked from commit 7f12c785bc284f4436ee8c32c4c0987e836ae9ed)

commit_message:
Add support for Trilio 4.1 and 20.01 Updates

Add Trilio 4.1 support

Includes updates to charmhelpers/charms.openstack for cert_utils
and unit-get for the install hook error on Juju 2.9

* ensure tox.ini is from release-tools
* ensure requirements.txt files are from release-tools
* On reactive charms:
  - ensure master branch for charms.openstack
  - ensure master branch for charm-helpers

Change-Id: Id0602f52bf8b33abb7fb444a020301c07a656c98

Reason for revert:

The timeout for the reboot should be handled by adjusting
UpgradeLeappRebootTimeout as can be seen in
https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/src/branch/stable/train/deployment/tripleo-packages/tripleo-packages-baremetal-puppet.yaml#L63-L66

commit_message:
Make os_glance namespace reserved

This adds a general mechanism for reserving property names that start
with os_glance. This has been done informally already, but no
enforcement was performed, except for specific keys on update. As a
result, banning these keys from create, for example, was missed and
users are able to set these keys during an POST /images operation.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/771234
Change-Id: I31b4dae018d52ead773db25472013d783066ee17
Closes-Bug: #1912001

commit_message:
Add yes overrides to the minor update roles

The tripleoclient will ask for a yes prompt before proceeding
with running minor update commands. Adding an override allows
skipping this prompt.

Change-Id: Ic8dcdf1c802d9c24683ba7ad0bb1e213847eed94

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-01 09:41:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix libvirt version discovery for CentOS Stream

CentOS Stream is Rolling-release distro that tracks just ahead of
Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) development [1]. While not recommended
in RDO, it's used to find potential issues before they are found in
official CentOS 8.

CentOS Stream is reported by facter as '8' with no minor version,
breaking the logic to discover the libvirtd version. This patch is
setting the version of libvirtd to 5.6 for all CdentOS 8 releases,
including Stream, as 8.0 is no longer supported.

[1] https://www.centos.org/centos-stream/

Change-Id: I468ecf06ac6e0853fbb296c011f20d63e38f6922
(cherry picked from commit b6294ce7a27379444ec9a447a51a6a1f83e9069f)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix libvirt version discovery for CentOS Stream

CentOS Stream is Rolling-release distro that tracks just ahead of
Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) development [1]. While not recommended
in RDO, it's used to find potential issues before they are found in
official CentOS 8.

CentOS Stream is reported by facter as '8' with no minor version,
breaking the logic to discover the libvirtd version. This patch is
setting the version of libvirtd to 5.6 for all CdentOS 8 releases,
including Stream, as 8.0 is no longer supported.

[1] https://www.centos.org/centos-stream/

Change-Id: I468ecf06ac6e0853fbb296c011f20d63e38f6922
(cherry picked from commit b6294ce7a27379444ec9a447a51a6a1f83e9069f)

In the volume.py module, the first parameter passed to the TaskMonitor
constructor was incorrect. The parameter passed was the resource object
(self), but it should have been the connector object (self._conn). This
affected the create_volume() and delete_volume() methods.

The constructor calls were updated to provide the correct connector
parameter. And the unit tests were updated to test that the TaskMonitor
objects are successfully created.

commit_message:
Fix TaskMonitor constructor calls in volume.py

In the volume.py module, the first parameter passed to the TaskMonitor
constructor was incorrect. The parameter passed was the resource object
(self), but it should have been the connector object (self._conn). This
affected the create_volume() and delete_volume() methods.

The constructor calls were updated to provide the correct connector
parameter. And the unit tests were updated to test that the TaskMonitor
objects are successfully created.

Change-Id: I10e564185b4cd9faa24739766536d39646f8a7c1
Story: 2003514
Task: 41720

Looks good to me. Especially after talking about the keyfile associated with the username we are now providing[1]

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-28 11:59:12.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Use specific user when probing encrypted rbd disks during extend

I0c3f14100a18107f7e416293f3d4fcc641ce5e55 introduced new logic when
extending LUKSv1 encrypted rbd volumes. As part of this qemu-img is used
to probe the rbd volume to determine the size of the LUKSv1 header.

The URI used to point to the rbd volume did not provide a user and
assumed that n-cpu/privsep would have access to the admin keyring. This
isn't always the case in most environments and would result in a failure
to probe the disk when the admin keyring wasn't available.

This change resolves this by appending the `id:$username` option to the
end of the URI provided to qemu-img using the `auth_username` found in
the connection_info from Cinder.

Closes-Bug: #1913575
Change-Id: Ia6d6dcdd7042f2aef6b3abeb5cd0f7525678a3b7
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Use specific user when probing encrypted rbd disks during extend

I0c3f14100a18107f7e416293f3d4fcc641ce5e55 introduced new logic when
extending LUKSv1 encrypted rbd volumes. As part of this qemu-img is used
to probe the rbd volume to determine the size of the LUKSv1 header.

The URI used to point to the rbd volume did not provide a user and
assumed that n-cpu/privsep would have access to the admin keyring. This
isn't always the case in most environments and would result in a failure
to probe the disk when the admin keyring wasn't available.

This change resolves this by appending the `id:$username` option to the
end of the URI provided to qemu-img using the `auth_username` found in
the connection_info from Cinder.

Closes-Bug: #1913575
Change-Id: Ia6d6dcdd7042f2aef6b3abeb5cd0f7525678a3b7

Change-Id: I7ea4b911f10c40b8228d6a369ecab56498c54889

commit_message:
Neutron ML2/OVS: add support to enable IGMP snooping

This knob, that defaults to False, allows to configure the Neutron
ML2 plugin config parameter "OVS.igmp_snooping_enable".
This parameter is used in the Neutron OVS agent.

Related-Bug: #1868569
Change-Id: I7ea4b911f10c40b8228d6a369ecab56498c54889

commit_message:
Revert "Add wait_for_connection check after system_upgrade"

This reverts commit 81ac511a2368b2475f24d6e02befef10ef4ec1bc.

Reason for revert:

The timeout for the reboot should be handled by adjusting
UpgradeLeappRebootTimeout as can be seen in
https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/src/branch/stable/train/deployment/tripleo-packages/tripleo-packages-baremetal-puppet.yaml#L63-L66

Change-Id: Id14ae95e47392596b661f627401435d44888df03

commit_message:
Add test_deps_setup_tripleo var

Currently ovs_dpdk molecule jobs are failing with openvswitch
package is not available.

test_deps_setup_tripleo for test_deps role fixes the issue.

Fixed the package name for openvswitch.
updated the job timig also.

Switch to ubi:8.2 base image in molecule job to fix package
conflict issue caused by ubi:8.3

Closes-Bug: #1905683
Closes-Bug: #1905687

Change-Id: Ie77be94849bba28f322a09d254be650a9ec687f5
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 641e378bde529d4575ad345c4ce1187a3c9b30df)

commit_message:
Cleanup more swift calls and change them to using tripleo-common

Update more of the swift client calls that I missed on my first pass. This
change will further reduce complexity as it will ensure more of our client
calls are taking advantage of tripleo-common instead of accesing the swift
client directly which will eventally allow us to run a swiftless undercloud.

Depends-On: Ibe9b2ffe94cdf493fc84366979d1d78b8528ea1b
Change-Id: I57afe3e145d6e4fa78c89ad58269cb268b031cb1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

subject: Upgrade the Monasca Fluentd output plugin
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-01 11:22:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-01 11:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2021-02-01 11:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nThanks - this is the only backport required.'}, {'account_id': 32657, 'date': '2021-02-01 11:45:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-01 13:37:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-01 11:22:17.000000000', 'message': 'Upgrade the Monasca Fluentd output plugin

From Victoria onwards a conflict is seen between the rest-client
library used by the Monasca Fluentd output plugin and the openssl
library. Specifically, a more recent release of openssl has dropped
a default which is referenced by the 1.8 release of the rest-client
library. In this commit we bump the Fluentd output plugin release
to pull in a more recent version of the rest-client library which
can handle this change.

Change-Id: Iae5402ea40c9f856b1787fdf82cc2389ffe0be03
Closes-Bug: 1910382
(cherry picked from commit b4e8826c0c69f224223c8a148f025dc132964757)
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrade the Monasca Fluentd output plugin

From Victoria onwards a conflict is seen between the rest-client
library used by the Monasca Fluentd output plugin and the openssl
library. Specifically, a more recent release of openssl has dropped
a default which is referenced by the 1.8 release of the rest-client
library. In this commit we bump the Fluentd output plugin release
to pull in a more recent version of the rest-client library which
can handle this change.

Change-Id: Iae5402ea40c9f856b1787fdf82cc2389ffe0be03
Closes-Bug: 1910382
(cherry picked from commit b4e8826c0c69f224223c8a148f025dc132964757)

commit_message:
Remove the wrongly placed release note files

The previous change[1] migrated the release note files to the correct
place, but this caused that the old release notes migrated from
manifests directory appear in the latest release note[2].
This patch remove that file to get rid of these confusing contents.

[1] 8fd11cfdd1f8ed527e5f3e041c4ae55b81bb2751
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/puppet-tripleo/unreleased.html

Change-Id: I31145093206903924d50d13d0bd90f136af45c14

subject: [ffwd] Don't run healthcheck on redis if it's not present

(cherry picked from commit 87c31a948b88d978b9b0c2dd252e73eee35eb8ae)

commit_message:
[ffwd] Don't run healthcheck on redis if it's not present

Redis might not be present on the deployment so we shouldn't
check it's status post upgrade.

Change-Id: Ie11acbf29fc8b9025756b5516fe2d9b4326b5425
Resolves: UPG-2446
(cherry picked from commit 87c31a948b88d978b9b0c2dd252e73eee35eb8ae)

commit_message:
Add missing ComputeNeutronMetadataAgent service into tripleo_containers.yaml.j2.

When using DVR the Compute roles make use of the services
ComputeNeutronOvsAgent, ComputeNeutronL3Agent, ComputeNeutronMetadataAgent
and ComputeNeutronCorePlugin. However, the ComputeNeutronMetadataAgent was
missing from the tripleo_containers.yaml.j2 which causes issues at the time
of retrieving the images from the Undercloud registry.

Related-Bug: #1898256
Change-Id: I52204ec1bcb3a43e5d8e8503871a27b8bfb88e7b
(cherry picked from commit d2a5d9856d109ce39f598dc64aeb41e9e4f3304b)

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I331232afa7fb438224a4bd700de0d3412fdcc9df

commit_message:
Skip bindings that don't exist

When fetching CNs from bindings, skip those that are not
available since not all charms have all bindings.

Closes-Bug: 1913313
Change-Id: Iad9616d3f8668782cd9c7dc498120536fb756da7
(cherry picked from commit 6a050f5b3c26eb3590793a947ec36ec7f88f761c)

subject: Remove projects.txt and friends
messages:
[{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-20 20:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-20 21:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

projects.txt is still used in tools/cruft.sh and playbooks/requirements-integration-dsvm/run.yaml - this needs further work.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-11-23 05:34:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> projects.txt is still used in tools/cruft.sh and playbooks/requirements-integration-dsvm/run.yaml
 > - this needs further work.

It's used in more places that that, like the update bot ?

I'm keen with getting rid of this so let me know if/where you need help"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-23 07:43:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The update bot uses it only for pushing requirements around - and that is not used anymore and that started this change.

I see no other users of projects.txt - and my open question is what to do with the integration job since it needs projects.txt - is it really testing what we need today? Tony, if you could look at that, it would be great!'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-11-24 00:54:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The update bot uses it only for pushing requirements around - and
 > that is not used anymore and that started this change.

Hmm when I looks last I though it was also used for manuals jobs

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/playbooks/proposal/propose_update.sh#n27

Are they also disabled/unneeded?

On top of requirements I also see:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/tree/inc/python#n493

And some follow-up changes in:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/project-team-guide/tree/doc/source/dependency-management.rst ; and 
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/system-config/tree/doc/source/gerrit.rst
 
 > I see no other users of projects.txt - and my open question is what
 > to do with the integration job since it needs projects.txt - is it
 > really testing what we need today? Tony, if you could look at that,
 > it would be great!

Okay I'll dig into that during the week."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-24 09:09:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

manuals jobs use the file projects.txt from openstack-manuals - but not requirements/projects.txt.

I'm just speaking here about the use of requirements/projects.txt"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-24 09:12:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

regarding the devstack usage - this is obsolete, there are no users, see http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=is_in_projects_txt&i=nope&files=&repos= 

The original purpose of projects.txt in requirements was for syncing requirements file to all repos listed in projects.txt. And we stopped that syncing, so should be able to cleanup now.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-24 09:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

devstack removal of the function is  https://review.openstack.org/619874'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-03-08 22:21:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

we are in freeze'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-03-27 21:32:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow

unfreeze'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-05-22 10:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

just merged :D'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-05-22 21:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

bad gertty'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-05-24 08:38:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-05-24 08:39:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Needs some more work - Tony, are you still going to help?'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-05-24 23:02:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Needs some more work - Tony, are you still going to help?

Yup it's still very much on my todo list for this cycle.

I've lost track of all thew places outside of requirements that will break once this merges but last time I looked there were several.  I see you've fixed devstack on *master* but IIRC the is also devstack-gate and some references in project-config.

We also need to think about stable branches and making sure branchless jobs work right.  Sorry all I have today is a bunch of questions rather than paths forward"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-05-25 08:31:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > Needs some more work - Tony, are you still going to help?
 > 
 > Yup it's still very much on my todo list for this cycle.
 > 
 > I've lost track of all thew places outside of requirements that
 > will break once this merges but last time I looked there were
 > several.  I see you've fixed devstack on *master* but IIRC the is
 > also devstack-gate and some references in project-config.
 
Project-config is done already.

I don't see a reference in devstack-gate.

devstack had an unused function.

I don't see a need to backport devstack since we do not backport this requirements change.

If you have some pointers, I'll happy to help - but looking at the above I dig a bit and codesearch showed that we all good - besides this repo.
To me, it looks like everything is good - but perhaps I look wrong. Do you have any searches?"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-05-28 01:53:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > > Needs some more work - Tony, are you still going to help?
 > >
 > > Yup it's still very much on my todo list for this cycle.
 > >
 > > I've lost track of all thew places outside of requirements that
 > > will break once this merges but last time I looked there were
 > > several.  I see you've fixed devstack on *master* but IIRC the is
 > > also devstack-gate and some references in project-config.
 > 
 > Project-config is done already.
 > 
 > I don't see a reference in devstack-gate.
 > 
 > devstack had an unused function.
 > 
 > I don't see a need to backport devstack since we do not backport
 > this requirements change.
 > 
 > If you have some pointers, I'll happy to help - but looking at the
 > above I dig a bit and codesearch showed that we all good - besides
 > this repo.
 > To me, it looks like everything is good - but perhaps I look wrong.
 > Do you have any searches?

So I haven't done a huge amount of research but from [1] I see a few hits.  The ones that standout as needing more investigation are:

 * https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/src/branch/master/playbooks/requirements-integration-dsvm/run.yaml#L128
 * https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/src/branch/master/playbooks/proposal/propose_update.sh#L27
 * https://opendev.org/openstack/pbr/src/branch/master/playbooks/legacy/pbr-installation-upstream-devstack/run.yaml#L129
 * https://opendev.org/openstack/pbr/src/branch/master/playbooks/legacy/pbr-installation-devstack/run.yaml#L129

I know the requirements repo will need *something* in the integration job, and I suspect that PBR will also[2] ... what that looks like I'm not sure.  I *think* the propose_update.sh thing is unused these days

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=projects.txt&i=nope&files=&repos=
[2] that something can very probably be a much shorter list that projects.txt is today."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-05-28 18:55:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

project-config is not handling this repo anymore - but the sync script still handles other repos like openstack-manuals that use projects.txt. The link you gave is for openstack-manuals.

Regarding pbr: Yes, that needs updating as well - worth to rewrite that job in Zuul v3 and hardcode some repos.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-04-23 04:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-04-23 04:37:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-23 04:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

tools/cruft.sh and tools/README.txt still use projects.txt - and pbr (see previous comment by tony)'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2020-09-11 15:33:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

-W for reqs freeze'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2021-02-01 14:03:52.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I won't finish this, requirements team can take over - or leave abandoned"}]

commit_message:
Remove projects.txt and friends

Change https://review.openstack.org/557326 removed the usage of
projects.txt, we are not syncing requirements anymore to projects.

Remove the projects.txt file and the jobs and tools for validating it.

Change-Id: I94be665bbbb81d97fef39d51647ab3d012b16c46

commit_message:
Tighten asserts in some wait tests

https://review.opendev.org/770537 introduced
a wait flag for shrink and extend methods.
The unit tests could use a tighter assert
statement so we catch possible future
regressions.

TrivialFix
Related bp: add-wait-to-async-commands

Change-Id: I5681a86589c5d59337dbad878a2bb0ebc732f831
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix formatting of LXC container config files

Spacing changes were inadvertently introduced in
https://review.opendev.org/742121 which result in duplicate entries
in LXC config files.

This commit reverts to the original formatting with spaces either
side of the '=', although it makes no attempt to fix files which
may already include duplicate entries.

Change-Id: Ia95bbc959b54f494b5861afcb4e84d4c227e7b31

Neutron ML2/OVN: Add support to enable IGMP Snooping

defaults to False for ML2/OVN deployments.

[OSC] Add the option to explicitly set share status

Implement the functionality of 'manila reset-state' command as
'openstack share set <share> --status'

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
as they are not actually used in tests (other than pep8).

more info: https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/blacklist.txt

Change-Id: I817c9a6b4e61bc50340dbdabcdd91b1bfb8aa04a

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-29 06:03:39.000000000', 'message': "Negative seqno need to be considered when comparing seqno

Need to consider Negative seqno to compare in some cases,
but the task does not support to do that, we need to make it work.

1.we use mariabackup to restore datas on control1, delete the
mariadb data on control2 and control3, and then use cluster recovery,
 as a result that the seqno of the other two nodes will be '-1'.

2. add one more control node into our existing mariadb cluster,
and then use cluster recovery, the seqno of the new node will be '-1'.

Change-Id: Ic1ac8656f28c3835e091637014f075ac5479d390
"}]
commit_message:
Negative seqno need to be considered when comparing seqno

Need to consider Negative seqno to compare in some cases,
but the task does not support to do that, we need to make it work.

1.we use mariabackup to restore datas on control1, delete the
mariadb data on control2 and control3, and then use cluster recovery,
 as a result that the seqno of the other two nodes will be '-1'.

2. add one more control node into our existing mariadb cluster,
and then use cluster recovery, the seqno of the new node will be '-1'.

Change-Id: Ic1ac8656f28c3835e091637014f075ac5479d390

subject: Temporary disable SSL for rabbit connections
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-01 12:25:54.000000000', 'message': 'Temporary disable SSL for rabbit connections

With amqp 5.0.3 defaults changed regarding self-signed certificates
verification, which results in [SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED]

So we disable ssl for rabbit by default until SSL topic is implemented.

Change-Id: I32a9809a0a23bb2c3a0a15ee5b95554e90cdd869
'}]
commit_message:
Temporary disable SSL for rabbit connections

With amqp 5.0.3 defaults changed regarding self-signed certificates
verification, which results in [SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED]

So we disable ssl for rabbit by default until SSL topic is implemented.

Change-Id: I32a9809a0a23bb2c3a0a15ee5b95554e90cdd869

commit_message:
Switch to collections.abc.MutableMapping

collections.MutableMapping has been deprecated since Python 3.3 and
is removed in Python 3.10. The functionality should be identical.

Change-Id: Ic96309fef409ba01dd24a3a70ff132a9f5352f9c

commit_message:
Consume horizon tempest test from tempest master

As disscussed in Wallaby PTG[1], QA and Horizon team
decided to move the horizon dashboard test from tempest-horizon
to Tempest. As next step, we can remove the tempest-horizon
plugin which will ease the maintaince of horizon tempest test.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/771727
Change-Id: I0dc58db29825446381c319ec904e8bf225b210e1
(cherry picked from commit 15cb035efb746a7e0747e0e3e3bcf6ed40ccaea1)

generate translation files without them.

commit_message:
Dropping explicit unicode literal

In python 3, all strings are considered as unicode string.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
or (u"..") appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: I50655850fe2d1baf34dee9938f35c92266ccab83

on a quick look I found still old occurrences of _log_console_output in tempest/scenario/test_network_v6.py and _create_security_group_rule in tempest/scenario/test_security_groups_basic_ops.py

Also please verify, that none of the renamed methods are used anywhere outside of tempest, otherwise we would break that consumer by merging this.'}, {'account_id': 30742, 'date': '2021-01-05 11:58:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1
> 
> on a quick look I found still old occurrences of _log_console_output in tempest/scenario/test_network_v6.py and _create_security_group_rule in tempest/scenario/test_security_groups_basic_ops.py
> 
> Also please verify, that none of the renamed methods are used anywhere outside of tempest, otherwise we would break that consumer by merging this.

Some of renamed methods are been used in heat, neutron and other projects. So what can be done in this case?'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-01-05 13:34:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Some of renamed methods are been used in heat, neutron and other projects. So what can be done in this case?

Therefore I would suggest to write a different review for each method rename, one for _create_security_group -> create_security_group, one for _log_console_output -> log_console_output and etc ... in that case we can deal with them individually - the ones which are not used outside of tempest can be merged and the ones which are used outside of tempest, well, we have 2 options there:
1. don't do the change
2. create a new method for transition period .. let's say we wanna rename _foo() but it's consumed somewhere outside of tempest - so we can move the logic of the method under foo() and let _foo() to call foo():
```
_foo():
    foo()
```
We should discuss the methods which are also consumed outside of tempest during the qa meeting and decide whether we wanna go with option 1 or 2."}, {'account_id': 30742, 'date': '2021-01-05 13:58:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> > Some of renamed methods are been used in heat, neutron and other projects. So what can be done in this case?
> 
> Therefore I would suggest to write a different review for each method rename, one for _create_security_group -> create_security_group, one for _log_console_output -> log_console_output and etc ... in that case we can deal with them individually - the ones which are not used outside of tempest can be merged and the ones which are used outside of tempest, well, we have 2 options there:
> 1. don't do the change
> 2. create a new method for transition period .. let's say we wanna rename _foo() but it's consumed somewhere outside of tempest - so we can move the logic of the method under foo() and let _foo() to call foo():
> ```
> _foo():
>     foo()
> ```
> We should discuss the methods which are also consumed outside of tempest during the qa meeting and decide whether we wanna go with option 1 or 2.

Correct. We will discuss this during the qa meeting"}, {'account_id': 30742, 'date': '2021-02-01 10:34:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

As per office hour discussion, this patch needs to be splitted in 3 another patches. Hence, this patch needs to be abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Need to make some apis non-private

Certain apis are implemented as private method
in scenario manager. Hence plugins can't use
directly from it.
Therefore, These apis need to be non-private.

Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable
Signed-off by: Soniya Vyas<svyas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7af8d951c744efbcd8d5a9a0d3a691f4639022c4

commit_message:
Check if patches remain opened on stale branches

Gerrit won't allow deletion of a branch with open reviews [1]. These changes
allow us to early detect that.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/020034.html

Change-Id: I603b1ac864b5b34db7466007b1bb78a0887f87b5

commit_message:
[OVN][Zuul] Copy OVN logs and databases

Since OVN has changed from being installed from packages instead of
compiling from source [0] the logs and databases are not being collected
by Zuul [1].

This patch fixes it.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/763402

[1] I mean, the logs are in the devstack.journal.xz file but it's a bit
painful to get to it, it's better to have it in separated files. And, the
databases are not being saved.

Change-Id: Ia9a3584bf7a0ecb7c00e5a6f4ffed7c8f29b16ba
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add host_vars to define tasks executed before network configurations

This change is a prep work to ensure tasks defined in ExtraConfigPre
and NodeExtraConfig are executed after network configurations.

Related-Bug: #1907214
Change-Id: I0e45090f8db1c1737e69ce906a12027bfe5c3ef0

commit_message:
Updates for testing period for 20.01 release

Includes updates to charmhelpers/charms.openstack for cert_utils
and unit-get for the install hook error on Juju 2.9

* charm-helpers sync for classic charms
* rebuild for reactive charms
* ensure tox.ini is from release-tools
* ensure requirements.txt files are from release-tools
* On reactive charms:
  - ensure master branch for charms.openstack
  - ensure master branch for charm-helpers

* Fix bundles as trilio-data-mover requires shared-db relation from
  version 4.1

Change-Id: Ia0c5e5f390744d4ad0febd1e5ee49d1b4dcc8a1f

commit_message:
Add ALPN support for pools

Users can define a list of application layer protocols to be negotiated
over a secure connection with members. For example, users can limit to
HTTP/2 or to HTTP/2 and HTTP/1.1 but exclude HTTP/1.0.

Change-Id: I6afbbf40949b6ad5fbe5ffaff01034c1cf8b16c9

subject: Module: tripleo_unprovision_network and cli playbook
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-01 06:55:48.000000000', 'message': 'Module: tripleo_unprovision_network and cli playbook

Add the ansible module `tripleo_unprovision_network`. Currently, We
don't have an automated way to clear the resources which
we create using "openstack network provision" command
/ `tripleo_composable_network` module.  This module will
be used to delete the composable networks.

This module will only delete a network and its sub resources if there
are no ports from corresponding subnets.

Also, Adds CLI playbook cli-overcloud-network-unprovision.yaml
Playbook loads configuration data file, iterates over each composable
network definition and calls the tripleo_unprovision_network to delete
the network.

WIP: Need to work on unittest, removing jobs from layout temporary to
save ci resources.

Change-Id: I4c04c942c1030c3a9ab5064ea49bd0a1e4c3883f
'}]
commit_message:
Module: tripleo_unprovision_network and cli playbook

Add the ansible module `tripleo_unprovision_network`. Currently, We
don't have an automated way to clear the resources which
we create using "openstack network provision" command
/ `tripleo_composable_network` module.  This module will
be used to delete the composable networks.

This module will only delete a network and its sub resources if there
are no ports from corresponding subnets.

Also, Adds CLI playbook cli-overcloud-network-unprovision.yaml
Playbook loads configuration data file, iterates over each composable
network definition and calls the tripleo_unprovision_network to delete
the network.

WIP: Need to work on unittest, removing jobs from layout temporary to
save ci resources.

Change-Id: I4c04c942c1030c3a9ab5064ea49bd0a1e4c3883f

commit_message:
relinker: Improve logging

Use the logger we instantiated in more places.

Pass the logger to audit_location_generator so we stand a chance at
actually seeing messages about failed mount checks.

Change-Id: Idda6512c0a2bc324bdba9ec341ec81d78b7b2f67
